Differential Equations | Euler equations and the indicial polynomial

[imath]\mathbf{a x}^{2} \mathbf{y}^{\prime \prime}+\mathbf{b x y}^{\prime}+\mathbf{c y}=\mathbf{0}[/imath]\nthe indicial polynomicl of a differenticl equation\n[imath]\mathbf{p}(\mathbf{r})=\mathbf{a r}(\mathbf{r}-\mathbf{1})+\mathbf{b r}+\mathbf{c}[/imath]
